turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: ... but I still recommend further simulation study.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mister Decker; every minute brings that object nearer Earth!  Engineering! Stand by for Warp Drive.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Explanation, Mr. Decker: Why was my phaser order countermanded?

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Sir, the Enterprise redesign increases phaser power by channeling it through the main engines. When they went into anti-matter imbalance, the phasers were automatically cut off.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Then you acted properly, of course.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Thank you, sir. I'm sorry I embar- rassed you.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You saved the ship.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: I'm aware of that, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Stop competing with me, Decker!

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Permission to speak freely, sir?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Granted.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Sir, you haven't logged a single star hour in two and a half years. That, plus your unfamiliarity with the ship's design -- in my opinion, sir, seriously jeopardizes our mission.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I trust you will... nursemaid me through these difficulties, Mister?

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Yes, sir, I'll do that.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: If our Executive Officer has no objections...?

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Of course not. I'm aware of Mister Spock's qualifications.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mister Chekov, log Mister Spock's Starfleet commission reactivated; list him as Science Officer; both effective immediately.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Recommend defensive posture, Captain: Screens and shields.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: No...  ... that could also be misinter- preted as hostile, Mr. Decker.  Cloud composition, Mr. Spock?

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Captain, we've seen what their weapons can do. Shouldn't we take every possible precaution -- ?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr Decker....

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: I advise caution, Captain; we can't withstand another attack.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That thing is twenty hours from Earth. We know nothing about it yet.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: That's precisely the point, Captain. We don't know it will do. Moving into the cloud -- at this time, is an unwarranted gamble.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: How do you define <U>unwarranted</U>, <U>mister</U>?!

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: You asked my opinion, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: <U>Computer off</U>!

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: It's taken control of the computer...!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It's running our records! Starfleet strength, Earth defenses...

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: The ship is under attack...! Man all defensive stations...!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Forcefields, full remaining strength...! Total reserve!

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Why bring us inside? Not to destroy us; they could have done that outside.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: They could have many ways of destroying things, Mr. Decker.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Captain, what's the next move?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The question is, Mr. Decker, <U>is</U> there a next move...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Well, Mr. Decker, it seems my bluff is being called.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: I'm afraid our hand is pretty weak, Captain.  But it's the only game in town.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: , if we do not provide     V'ger with certain information, we won't have twenty-two <U>seconds</U>; the plan must be implemented upon arrival.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Captain, we can't be sure that our... move... will actually save Earth.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Decker... I will contact you every five minutes. Otherwise... inform Mr. Scott immediately.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Captain... I'd like to go along...

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: The fault is here, sir, not in the transmission.  The antenna leads have been disconnected. V'ger never intended to accept a transmitted signal.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Capture God! In order to retrieve V'ger's data, the Creator has to physically come here!...

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: And plug the signal directly into the circuitry at this...  ... point here, Captain. It should pick up even a tricorder playback.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Enterprise, I want that signal again. Transmit!

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: They may have attacked only as a warning to us, Captain. To keep away.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: That would presuppose a feeling, Commander... compassion. I sensed <U>no</U> emotion, only...  ... pure logic.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: We could have cut it off at the main computer...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: This served the purpose.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Captain... this probe may be a key a key to the Aliens.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: It's a programmed <U>mechanism</U>, Mr. Spock...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: We have just seen that its body duplicates our navigator in <U>precise</U> detail. Suppose that beneath its programming, the real Ilia's memory patterns are duplicated with equal precision.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Exactly.  And you did have a 'relationship' with Lieutenant Ilia, Commander.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: That probe in there -- in a different form now -- is the same thing that <U>killed</U> Ilia!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Then V'ger believes the Creator to be a <U>machine</U> too.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: It seems we <U>all</U> imagine God in our own image.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Forward motion, Captain...!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: A tractor beam...

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Mr. Spock, what would V'ger need to fulfill itself?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: V'ger has begun to understand the true limits of our universe, thereby realizing the existence of other dimensions. To fulfill itself it must evolve to a higher dimension; V'ger believes this can be achieved only by joining with the Creator.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: That transmitter is a vital link between V'ger and the Creator.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: We have twenty-one minutes. Captain,    we can still save V'ger... and ourselves.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Jim... he <U>wants</U> it.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: You got the Enterprise, it's what <U>you</U> wanted. This is what I want.  But, Jim...  ... <U>I'm</U> the right choice for this mission.

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Hello, Ilia.

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: Decker....!

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: I now the Captain meant no person- al insult.

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: I would never take advantage of a sexually immature species.  You can assure him that's true, can't you?

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Negative control from inertial lag will continue 22 point five seconds before forward velocity slows to sub-light speed.

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: Unidentified small object has been pulled into the wormhole with us, Captain! Directly ahead...!

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: Navigational deflectors inoperative...!  Directional control also inoperative, Captain...!

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: Wormhole distortion has over- loaded main power systems...!

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: Was he difficult?

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: No more than I expected  Not as difficult as this. I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: That you left? or that you didn't say 'goodbye'?

turns.speaker: DECKER
turns.text: If I'd seen you again, would you have been able to say it?

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: Lieutenant Ilia reporting for duty, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Welcome aboard, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: 'Commander' Decker?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Our Exec and Science Officer...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: And in you, too, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: My oath of celibacy is on record Captain. May I assume my duties?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Time to impact...?

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: Twelve seconds...!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Chekov, stand by on the phasers...!

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: Five minutes to Cloud boundary!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I stand corrected Mr. Decker.  Navigator, lay in a conic section flight path into the cloud center; bring us parallel to whatever we find in there...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Spock?

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: Impact in fifteen seconds...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Transmit, Mr. Spock! Now!

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: Ten seconds....

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: Thirty seconds to Cloud boundary...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Opinion, Mister. Spock?

turns.speaker: ILIA
turns.text: Fifteen seconds to Cloud Boundary.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Viewer, standard ahead.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I appreciate the welcome; I wish the circumstances were less critical.  Epsilon Nine is monitoring the intruder; keep a channel open to them.  Where is Captain Decker?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: He's in Engineering, sir...  He doesn't know.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Maneuvering thrusters, Mister Sulu.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Maneuvering thrusters, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Hold station.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Thrusters at station-keeping, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Ahead Warp One, Mr Sulu.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Accelerating to Warp One, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Sulu, steady as she goes.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Reduce magnification. Factor 4, Mr. Sulu.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: We're already two settings below that, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Adjust parallel course, Navigator. Bring us in to one hundred kilometers distance.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: One hundred kilometers...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Hold relative position here...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Viewer ahead.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Viewer ahead, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Maneuvering thrusters, Mr. Sulu; ahead one third.  Full sensor scan, Mr. Spock; they can't expect us <U>not</U> to look them over now!

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Thrusters ahead, one third.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Hold station...!

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Thrusters at station keeping...

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Clear the bridge, Captain...?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That was the order, Mr. Sulu: Clear the bridge.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Admiral, I've been hoping to see you. Maybe you can get through to those thick heads in Starfleet that...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Why aren't the Enterprise transporters in operation, Mister Scott?

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: We're hoping it's only a temporary problem, Admiral...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: See that it is.  Take me over, please.

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: Admiral, the Enterprise has just finished eighteen months redesign- ing and refitting. She needs testing, a shakedown...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott, there's an alien object with unbelievable destructive power less than three days away from this planet...

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: The crew hasn't had near enough transition time with all the new equipment. And the engines, Admiral: they've yet to be even tested at warp power. Add to that, an untried Captain...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Two and a half years as Chief of Starfleet Operations may have made me a little stale, Mr. Scott -- but I wouldn't exactly consider myself 'untried.'

turns.speaker: SCOTT
turns.text: We're losing the pattern...!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Starfleet, boost your matter gain; we need more signal!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Reporting as ordered, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Sit down, please.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Sir, I would appreciate Dr. McCoy absenting himself from this interview.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I want him here.  Sit down!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You've reported that you felt strong thought emotions. A group of minds from a space vessel? Could you make out any plan, anything to do with Earth?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Negative, Captain. I could sense only what seemed an almost omniscient pattern of perfect logic. I can explain nothing more; I understand nothing more.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Also -- there was nothing in your report about <U>why</U> you're here.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: That inquiry invades my personal life, Captain.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I still contain fragments of my human half.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: And whatever you sensed out here....

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: ... is my only hope of accomplishing what the Masters could not.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Let it drop, Bones.  You are my Science Officer -- I'll expect an <U>immediate</U> report on anything further you learn or <U>sense</U> from here on.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I have accepted service here as a Starfleet officer... sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I know this has been painful, Spock. For me too. Thank you.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Do <U>not</U> return scan, Mr. Spock! It may be misinterpreted as hostility!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Intruder scans emanate from the exact cloud center. Energy of a type entirely un- known to me.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Captain, I suspect there's an object at the heart of that cloud.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Decker, I will not provoke an attack, If that order isn't clear to you...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: They have... they <U>have</U> been communicating with us. I sense ... <U>puzzlement</U>. Why have we not replied?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Communicated with us <U>how</U>?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: It appears that our message has been understood, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Any reply from them?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The 'puzzlement' I sensed was fleeting... minor...  ... as if carrying a sense of our insignificance, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Our... 'insignificance'?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: We are obviously confronted by a highly advanced mentality... yet they cannot understand who we are, or what we want.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: But they understood our messages; they broke off the attack.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Recommend we proceede, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Decker... ?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: No vessel could generate a powerfield of this magnitude...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Instruments fluctuating, Captain. Patterns unrecognizable.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: That vessel is generating a forcefield measurably greater than the radiation of the Earth's sun.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Transmit image of the Alien to Starfleet; advise we are attempting further communication.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Captain, we have been seized by a tractor beam...!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Get someone up here to take the Navigator's station...!  Engineering... full emergency power!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: We cannot break free, Captain.  We do not have a fraction of the power necessary.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Delay that order, Scotty...! Disengage all main drive systems!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Have you been able to analyze <U>any</U> of this...?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I believe the light flares to be energy fields -- undoubtedly part of the vessel's inner mechanism. A technology so incredibly sophisticated that I cannot --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: They had a pattern to follow...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: ... they may have followed it <U>too</U> precisely.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Ilia's memory, her feelings of loyalty, friendship, obedience... might all be there.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock? Concerned about his chances?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I am uneasy with that being our only hope of more information.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Bridge, cancel rescue teams.  Spock, what in the hell are you doing out here!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I am seeking answers, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Answers to what, Spock? Our dilemma -- or your <U>personal</U> one?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: It would appear that the atomic arrays of these crystals store information. A remarkably efficient system.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: And these 'sensor-swarms' collect that data, carry it here.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: New crystals: they must contain the most recent data obtained --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Klingons... our Epsilon 9 station ... and Ilia!! They seem to be more than just images...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Exact patterns. The energy bolt that hit them wasn't simply a weapon -- it dematerialized them, stored them. But why?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: If this is their ship's data banks, where is the crew? Or is their entire ship automated?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Captain, I do not believe there <U>is</U> a crew -- or that this is a vessel as such.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Were you right? Spock? V'ger is a living machine...?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: A life form of its own; a conscious, living entity.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What should you have known?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: No meaning... No hope...  And, Jim, no answers...! Jim, it's looking for <U>answers</U> <U>itself</U>!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What answers?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: 'Is this all I am? Is there not more?'

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: These read as identical composition...  ... however, Captain, they measure several hundred times more powerful!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: High mag, Mr. Sulu!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Child...!?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Yes, Captain, a child: evolving into adulthood -- learning, searching -- instinctively needing.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The orbiting devices would be controlled from the point, then...?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Precisely.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Not for us?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: No, Captain, not for us... for V'ger.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Has not, Doctor -- and now, because of what we are planning... will not...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: There is no alternative.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Captain, the orbital device will      not be triggered for twenty-two       minutes...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The point...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The point is, Captain, <U>twenty-two</U>

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: V'ger plans to literally <U>meld</U> to reduce both itself and the Creator to patterns...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: ... and then to reassemble itself <U>combined</U> with the Creator. The most certain way of obtaining all the Creator's answers.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: There's no way to know. V'ger expected it to be a machine -- some single entity.  All of us here may be reduced into patterns...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: That seems to be what it has planned -- to have the Creator physically present here.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock, we <U>were</U> its answer!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Yes, Captain. It needed our mortality, the fear of it, our struggle against it, our fears, our dreams...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: ... and the 'foolish' emotions which drive us?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I prefer your poet Dante's phrase -- 'the divine restlessness of the human spirit.'

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You've received your appointment as Enterprise Science Officer?

turns.speaker: SONAK
turns.text: Based, I am told, on your recommendation, Admiral. Thank you.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Why aren't you on board?

turns.speaker: SONAK
turns.text: Captain Decker requested I complete final Science briefing here before...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Here at Starfleet...? The Enterprise is in final preparation to leave dock...

turns.speaker: SONAK
turns.text: Which will require twenty more hours at minimum, Admiral...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Twelve! I'm on my way to a meeting with Admiral Nogura which will not last more than three minutes. Report to me on the Enterprise in one hour.

turns.speaker: SONAK
turns.text: To you, sir?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I intend to be there following that meeting. Report to me. One hour!

turns.speaker: SCOTT'S INTERCOM VOICE
turns.text: Captain, we need further Warp simulation on the flow sensors...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Engineer, we need Warp speed now!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Warp Drive as soon as possible, Mr. Scott.

turns.speaker: SCOTT'S INTERCOM VOICE
turns.text: Captain, it was our anti-matter imbalance that created the wormhole in the first place. It will happen again if we don't correct it.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That object out there is less than two days from Earth, Mister Scott. We've got to intercept while it still is out there!

turns.speaker: SCOTT'S INTERCOM VOICE
turns.text: Aye, we understand that sir! We're doing our best.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Engineering... Status, Mr. Scott?

turns.speaker: SCOTT'S INTERCOM VOICE
turns.text: We're ready, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Thank you, Scotty. Stand by.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Transporters Room and Chief Engineer Scott report trans- porter system fully repaired and now functioning normally, sir.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Dock signals clear, Captain.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Dock control reports ready, sir.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Helm ready, sir.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Negative helm control, Captain! Going reverse on impulse power...!

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Subspace frequencies are jammed by Wormhole effect!

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Starfleet signals, sir, growing in strength...  They -- have Intruder on their monitors -- it's decelerating -- powerfield cloud beginning to dissipate...

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Confirm, Captain. Lunar beacons indicate Intruder on a course into Earth orbit...

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: The third one is moving off too -- a fourth one is forming...

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: <U>Urgent</U> signal from Starfleet, Captain!  <U>All</U> Earth defense systems have gone dead.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Starfleet has been apprised of our situation, Captain.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Tractor beam remains constant...

turns.speaker: CAL
turns.text: Evening, Annie.

turns.speaker: ANN
turns.text: Evening, Cal.  Would you tell me about it?
